original: THE TAILOR OF GLOUCESTER
final: jan pi pali len tan ma tomo Kota~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pi pali len tan ma tomo Kota

original: IN the time of swords and periwigs and full-skirted coats with flowered lappets—when gentlemen wore ruffles, and gold-laced waistcoats of paduasoy and taffeta—there lived a tailor in Gloucester.
final: tenpo pi toki ni la, jan li jo e palisa utala kiwen, li len e lawa kepeken linja len suli, li len kepeken len suli pi namako pona mute, li len kepeken len pi linja sike mute, li len kepeken len pi sijelo sewi taso, li len kepeken len suno. tenpo pi toki ni la, jan pi pali len li lon ma tomo Kota.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: tenpo pi toki ni la, jan li jo e palisa utala kiwen, li len e lawa kepeken linja len suli, li len kepeken len suli pi namako pona mute, li len kepeken len pi linja sike mute, li len kepeken len pi sijelo sewi taso, li len kepeken len suno. tenpo pi toki ni la, jan pi pali len li lon ma tomo Kota.

original: He sat in the window of a little shop in Westgate Street, cross-legged on a table from morning till dark.
final: ona li lape e monsi ona lon poka pi lupa lukin, lon tomo pi pali len, lon nasin Lupawese. ona li nasin e noka ona kepeken nasin ante, li awen lon supa pali lon ale pi tenpo suno.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ona li lape e monsi ona lon poka pi lupa lukin, lon tomo pi pali len, lon nasin Lupawese. ona li nasin e noka ona kepeken nasin ante, li awen lon supa pali lon ale pi tenpo suno.

original: All day long while the light lasted he sewed and snippetted, piecing out his satin, and pompadour, and lutestring; stuffs had strange names, and were very expensive in the days of the Tailor of Gloucester.
final: suno li lon la, ona li pali len, li tu e len, li wan e len. ona li pali e len suno, e  len pi namako mute mute. len ale ni li nasa, taso ona li suli tawa jan pi tenpo ni, li mani mute.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: suno li lon la, ona li pali len, li tu e len, li wan e len. ona li pali e len suno, e  len pi namako mute mute. len ale ni li nasa, taso ona li suli tawa jan pi tenpo ni, li mani mute.

original: But although he sewed fine silk for his neighbours, he himself was very, very poor—a little old man in spectacles, with a pinched face, old crooked fingers, and a suit of threadbare clothes.
final: taso jan pali li pali mute e len ni tawa jan ante la, ona li jo e mani pi lili mute. ona li lon tenpo mute, li wile kepeken ilo lukin. sinpin ona li ante tan tenpo. palisa luka ona li ante tan pali mute. len ona li kama wawa ala.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: taso jan pali li pali mute e len ni tawa jan ante la, ona li jo e mani pi lili mute. ona li lon tenpo mute, li wile kepeken ilo lukin. sinpin ona li ante tan tenpo. palisa luka ona li ante tan pali mute. len ona li kama wawa ala.

original: He cut his coats without waste; according to his embroidered cloth, they were very small ends and snippets that lay about upon the table—"Too narrow breadths for nought—except waistcoats for mice," said the tailor.
final: jan pali li tu e len tawa ona taso la, ona li wile weka ala e len, li weka e len lili taso. len lili ni li lon supa pali la, ona li toki e ni: "len ni li lili taso. mi ken ala kepeken ona. ni li pona tawa soweli pi lili mute taso."~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li tu e len tawa ona taso la, ona li wile weka ala e len, li weka e len lili taso. len lili ni li lon supa pali la, ona li toki e ni: "len ni li lili taso. mi ken ala kepeken ona. ni li pona tawa soweli pi lili mute taso."

original: One bitter cold day near Christmas-time the tailor began to make a coat (a coat of cherry-coloured corded silk embroidered with pansies and roses) and a cream-coloured satin waistcoat (trimmed with gauze and green worsted chenille) for the Mayor of Gloucester.
final: tenpo lete suli la, tenpo sewi li lon tenpo kama. jan pali li pali e len pi awen seli. (len ni li loje kili. linja ona li suno lili. kasi pi lipu kule li sitelen lon ona.) jan li pali e len pi sijelo sewi tan len pi walo jelo. (ko len walo en len ko pi laso kasi li lon pini pi lupa ona.) jan pali li pali e ni tawa jan lawa pi ma tomo Kota.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: tenpo lete suli la, tenpo sewi li lon tenpo kama. jan pali li pali e len pi awen seli. (len ni li loje kili. linja ona li suno lili. kasi pi lipu kule li sitelen lon ona.) jan li pali e len pi sijelo sewi tan len pi walo jelo. (ko len walo en len ko pi laso kasi li lon pini pi lupa ona.) jan pali li pali e ni tawa jan lawa pi ma tomo Kota.

original: The tailor worked and worked, and he talked to himself. He measured the silk, and turned it round and round, and trimmed it into shape with his shears; the table was all littered with cherry-coloured snippets.
final: jan pali li pali, li pali la, ona li toki, taso toki ni li tawa ona taso. ona li lukin e suli len, li tawa e len lon nasin sike, lon nasin sike, li tu e len kepeken ilo. supa pali ona la, lili len loje mute li lon.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li pali, li pali la, ona li toki, taso toki ni li tawa ona taso. ona li lukin e suli len, li tawa e len lon nasin sike, lon nasin sike, li tu e len kepeken ilo. supa pali ona la, lili len loje mute li lon.

original: No breadth at all, and cut on the cross; it is no breadth at all; tippets for mice and ribbons for mobs! for mice! said the Tailor of Gloucester.
final: jan pali len pi ma Kota li toki e ni: "suli len li lili a; mi tu e linja; suli len li lili taso; li pona tawa soweli pi lili mute taso"~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali len pi ma Kota li toki e ni: "suli len li lili a; mi tu e linja; suli len li lili taso; li pona tawa soweli pi lili mute taso"

original: When the snow-flakes came down against the small leaded window-panes and shut out the light, the tailor had done his day's work; all the silk and satin lay cut out upon the table.
final: ko lete walo li kama tan sewi, li len e lupa lukin, li len e suno tan lupa la, jan pali li pini e pali. len pi pali pini li lon supa pali.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ko lete walo li kama tan sewi, li len e lupa lukin, li len e suno tan lupa la, jan pali li pini e pali. len pi pali pini li lon supa pali.

original: There were twelve pieces for the coat and four pieces for the waistcoat; and there were pocket-flaps and cuffs and buttons, all in order. For the lining of the coat there was fine yellow taffeta, and for the buttonholes of the waistcoat there was cherry-coloured twist. And everything was ready to sew together in the morning, all measured and sufficient—except that there was wanting just one single skein of cherry-coloured twisted silk.
final: len lili luka luka tu li tawa len pi awen seli. len lili tu tu li tawa len pi sijelo sewi. len lipu pi poki pini en len namako pi luka pini en kiwen pi len awen li lon, li pona. len awen la, poka insa li jelo pona suno. len sijelo la, linja selo pi loje kili li lon lupa pi awen pini. ale li pona tawa pali pi tenpo suno kama la jan pali li ken wan e len — taso ijo wan li lon ala: linja loje li lili taso.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: len lili luka luka tu li tawa len pi awen seli. len lili tu tu li tawa len pi sijelo sewi. len lipu pi poki pini en len namako pi luka pini en kiwen pi len awen li lon, li pona. len awen la, poka insa li jelo pona suno. len sijelo la, linja selo pi loje kili li lon lupa pi awen pini. ale li pona tawa pali pi tenpo suno kama la jan pali li ken wan e len — taso ijo wan li lon ala: linja loje li lili taso.

original: The tailor came out of his shop at dark, for he did not sleep there at nights; he fastened the window and locked the door, and took away the key. No one lived there at nights but little brown mice, and they ran in and out without any keys!
final: jan pi pali len li kama weka tan esun ona lon tenpo pimeja. ona li lape ala lon esun. ona li pini e lupa ale, li awen e ilo open. jan ala li lon tomo lon tenpo pimeja. soweli pi lili mute li lon, taso ona li kepeken ala ilo open.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pi pali len li kama weka tan esun ona lon tenpo pimeja. ona li lape ala lon esun. ona li pini e lupa ale, li awen e ilo open. jan ala li lon tomo lon tenpo pimeja. soweli pi lili mute li lon, taso ona li kepeken ala ilo open.

original: For behind the wooden wainscots of all the old houses in Gloucester, there are little mouse staircases and secret trap-doors; and the mice run from house to house through those long, narrow passages; they can run all over the town without going into the streets.
final: tomo ale pi ma Kota la, ijo li lon insa sinpin. sona ala la, nasin lili pi tawa sewi en lupa lili li lon. soweli pi lili mute li kepeken ona, li ken tawa ale pi ma tomo, li ken awen lon insa kepeken nasin ala pi insa ala.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: tomo ale pi ma Kota la, ijo li lon insa sinpin. sona ala la, nasin lili pi tawa sewi en lupa lili li lon. soweli pi lili mute li kepeken ona, li ken tawa ale pi ma tomo, li ken awen lon insa kepeken nasin ala pi insa ala.

original: But the tailor came out of his shop and shuffled home through the snow; he lived quite near by in College Court, next the doorway to College Green. And although it was not a big house, the tailor was so poor he only rented the kitchen.
final: a. jan pi pali len li kama weka tan esun ona, li tawa lon lete ko walo, li tawa tomo ona. tomo lape ona li lon nasin Masona, li lon poka pi ma kasi Petasona. tomo li tomo suli ala. taso jan pali li jo e mani lili taso la, ona li ken pana e mani tawa tomo moku taso, li awen lon ni taso.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: a. jan pi pali len li kama weka tan esun ona, li tawa lon lete ko walo, li tawa tomo ona. tomo lape ona li lon nasin Masona, li lon poka pi ma kasi Petasona. tomo li tomo suli ala. taso jan pali li jo e mani lili taso la, ona li ken pana e mani tawa tomo moku taso, li awen lon ni taso.

original: He lived alone with his cat; it was called Simpkin.
final: ona li lon tomo la, soweli ona pi kalama noka ala li lon. nimi soweli li Sinkin.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ona li lon tomo la, soweli ona pi kalama noka ala li lon. nimi soweli li Sinkin.

original: Now all day long while the tailor was out at work, Simpkin kept house by himself; and he also was fond of the mice, though he gave them no satin for coats!
final: jan pali li weka, li pali lon ale pi tenpo suno la, soweli Sinkin li wan taso lon tomo. soweli pi lili mute li pona tawa ona. taso ona li pana ala e len pona tawa soweli lili.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li weka, li pali lon ale pi tenpo suno la, soweli Sinkin li wan taso lon tomo. soweli pi lili mute li pona tawa ona. taso ona li pana ala e len pona tawa soweli lili.

original: Miaw? said the cat when the tailor opened the door, "miaw?"
final: jan pali li open e lupa, li kama insa la, soweli li wile sona e ni: mu?~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li open e lupa, li kama insa la, soweli li wile sona e ni: mu?

original: The tailor replied: "Simpkin, we shall make our fortune, but I am worn to a ravelling. Take this groat (which is our last fourpence), and, Simpkin, take a china pipkin, buy a penn'orth of bread, a penn'orth of milk, and a penn'orth of sausages. And oh, Simpkin, with the last penny of our fourpence buy me one penn'orth of cherry-coloured silk. But do not lose the last penny of the fourpence, Simpkin, or I am undone and worn to a thread-paper, for I have no more twist."
final: jan pali li toki e ni: "soweli Sinkin o, mi kama jo e mani mute lon tenpo, taso wawa mi li lili sama linja lili. mi pana e mani lili ni. ona li mani mi nanpa pini. soweli Sinkin o, kepeken ona. o kepeken poki kiwen. mani ni la, o esun e pan wan, e telo walo wan tan soweli mani, e moku palisa ko soweli. mani li kama ala pini tan ni la, o esun linja loje tawa pali len mi kepeken mani pini. o weka ala e mani pini ni a, soweli Sinkin o. mani li kama weka la, mi kama weka kin, mi kama anpa tan weka pi linja loje.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li toki e ni: "soweli Sinkin o, mi kama jo e mani mute lon tenpo, taso wawa mi li lili sama linja lili. mi pana e mani lili ni. ona li mani mi nanpa pini. soweli Sinkin o, kepeken ona. o kepeken poki kiwen. mani ni la, o esun e pan wan, e telo walo wan tan soweli mani, e moku palisa ko soweli. mani li kama ala pini tan ni la, o esun linja loje tawa pali len mi kepeken mani pini. o weka ala e mani pini ni a, soweli Sinkin o. mani li kama weka la, mi kama weka kin, mi kama anpa tan weka pi linja loje.

original: Then Simpkin again said "Miaw!" and took the groat and the pipkin, and went out into the dark.
final: soweli Sinkin li mu sin, li jo e mani e poki, li tawa ma lon pimeja.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli Sinkin li mu sin, li jo e mani e poki, li tawa ma lon pimeja.

original: The tailor was very tired and beginning to be ill. He sat down by the hearth and talked to himself about that wonderful coat.
final: jan pali li pilin lape mute. sijelo ona li kama nasa; ona li pilin nasa. ona li tawa poka pi poki seli, li toki e len pi pali ona tawa ona taso.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li pilin lape mute. sijelo ona li kama nasa; ona li pilin nasa. ona li tawa poka pi poki seli, li toki e len pi pali ona tawa ona taso.

original: I shall make my fortune—to be cut bias—the Mayor of Gloucester is to be married on Christmas Day in the morning, and he hath ordered a coat and an embroidered waistcoat—to be lined with yellow taffeta—and the taffeta sufficeth; there is no more left over in snippets than will serve to make tippets for mice——
final: mani mute o kama tawa mi. len o selo lon sijelo sama selo sijelo. jan lawa pi ma tomo Kota en olin ona li kama wan lon tenpo suno sewi. ona li toki e wile ona la ona li wile e len pi awen seli, e len pi sijelo sewi kepeken linja namako — kepeken len suno jelo kin. mute pi len suno ni li pona; mi ken ala kepeken len suno lili, mi ken kepeken ona tawa soweli pi lili mute a taso——~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: mani mute o kama tawa mi. len o selo lon sijelo sama selo sijelo. jan lawa pi ma tomo Kota en olin ona li kama wan lon tenpo suno sewi. ona li toki e wile ona la ona li wile e len pi awen seli, e len pi sijelo sewi kepeken linja namako — kepeken len suno jelo kin. mute pi len suno ni li pona; mi ken ala kepeken len suno lili, mi ken kepeken ona tawa soweli pi lili mute a taso——

original: Then the tailor started; for suddenly, interrupting him, from the dresser at the other side of the kitchen came a number of little noises—
final: lon tenpo ni a la ona li tawa sewi kepeken wawa tan ni: kalama lili li kama tan supa poki lon poka ante tomo—~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: lon tenpo ni a la ona li tawa sewi kepeken wawa tan ni: kalama lili li kama tan supa poki lon poka ante tomo—

original: Tip tap, tip tap, tip tap tip!
final: Noka-Noka-Noka-Noka Lili a!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: Noka-Noka-Noka-Noka Lili a!

original: Now what can that be? said the Tailor of Gloucester, jumping up from his chair. The dresser was covered with crockery and pipkins, willow pattern plates, and tea-cups and mugs.
final: jan pi pali len li toki e ni: aa, ni li seme? ona li tawa sewi tan supa ona. ilo moku en poki moku en pki telo en kiwen supa moku li lon supa poki.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pi pali len li toki e ni: aa, ni li seme? ona li tawa sewi tan supa ona. ilo moku en poki moku en pki telo en kiwen supa moku li lon supa poki.

original: The tailor crossed the kitchen, and stood quite still beside the dresser, listening, and peering through his spectacles. Again from under a teacup came those funny little noises—
final: jan pali li tawa supa poki, li awen lon poka ona, li kute, li lukin kepeken ilo oko ona. sin la, kalama musi ni li tan poki telo wan—~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li tawa supa poki, li awen lon poka ona, li kute, li lukin kepeken ilo oko ona. sin la, kalama musi ni li tan poki telo wan—

original: Tip tap, tip tap, tip tap tip!
final: Noka-Noka-Noka-Noka Lili a!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: Noka-Noka-Noka-Noka Lili a!

original: This is very peculiar, said the Tailor of Gloucester, and he lifted up the tea-cup which was upside down.
final: jan pali li toki e ni: ni li nasa a. ona li sewi e poki telo.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li toki e ni: ni li nasa a. ona li sewi e poki telo.

original: Out stepped a little live lady mouse, and made a courtesy to the tailor! Then she hopped away down off the dresser, and under the wainscot.
final: soweli pi lili mute li kama tan anpa poki. ona li anpa lili sama pona toki tawa jan pali. ona li tawa weka tan supa poki, li tawa anpa sinpin.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli pi lili mute li kama tan anpa poki. ona li anpa lili sama pona toki tawa jan pali. ona li tawa weka tan supa poki, li tawa anpa sinpin.

original: The tailor sat down again by the fire, warming his poor cold hands, and mumbling to himself:—
final: jan li tawa sin lon poka seli, li seli e luka ona, li toki tawa ona taso:—~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan li tawa sin lon poka seli, li seli e luka ona, li toki tawa ona taso:—

original: The waistcoat is cut out from peach-coloured satin—tambour stitch and rose-buds in beautiful floss silk! Was I wise to entrust my last fourpence to Simpkin? One-and-twenty buttonholes of cherry-coloured twist!
final: a, len pali li tan len suno loje, kepeken linja sitelen sama kasi kule, kepeken linja ko! a, mi pana e mani pini mi tawa soweli Sinkin la, ni li pona ala pona? a, kiwen len li kepeken linja loje!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: a, len pali li tan len suno loje, kepeken linja sitelen sama kasi kule, kepeken linja ko! a, mi pana e mani pini mi tawa soweli Sinkin la, ni li pona ala pona? a, kiwen len li kepeken linja loje!

original: But all at once, from the dresser, there came other little noises—
final: taso tenpo ni la, kalama lili ante li kama tan supa poki~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: taso tenpo ni la, kalama lili ante li kama tan supa poki

original: Tip tap, tip tap, tip tap tip!
final: Noka-Noka-Noka-Noka Lili a!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: Noka-Noka-Noka-Noka Lili a!

original: This is passing extraordinary! aid the Tailor of Gloucester, and turned over another tea-cup, which was upside down.
final: ja pali li pilin e ni: ni li kama nasa a! ona li sewi e poki telo ante.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ja pali li pilin e ni: ni li kama nasa a! ona li sewi e poki telo ante.

original: Out stepped a little gentleman mouse, and made a bow to the tailor!
final: soweli mije pi lili mute li kama tan anpa poki, li anpa lili sama pona toki tawa jan pali!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli mije pi lili mute li kama tan anpa poki, li anpa lili sama pona toki tawa jan pali!

original: And then from all over the dresser came a chorus of little tappings, all sounding together, and answering one another, like watch-beetles in an old worm-eaten window-shutter—
final: ni la, kalama mute pi noka mute pi li kama, li kama tan ale pi supa poki, li kama kalama kulupu, li kalama sama toki kulupu, li kalama mute.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ni la, kalama mute pi noka mute pi li kama, li kama tan ale pi supa poki, li kama kalama kulupu, li kalama sama toki kulupu, li kalama mute.

original: Tip tap, tip tap, tip tap tip!
final: Noka-Noka-Noka-Noka Lili a!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: Noka-Noka-Noka-Noka Lili a!

original: And out from under tea-cups and from under bowls and basins, stepped other and more little mice, who hopped away down off the dresser and under the wainscot.
final: tan anpa pi poki lili la, tan poki telo la, tan poki moku la, tan poku supa la, soweli mute pi lili mute li kama, li tawa weka, li tawa anpa sinpin.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: tan anpa pi poki lili la, tan poki telo la, tan poki moku la, tan poku supa la, soweli mute pi lili mute li kama, li tawa weka, li tawa anpa sinpin.

original: The tailor sat down, close over the fire, lamenting: "One-and-twenty buttonholes of cherry-coloured silk! To be finished by noon of Saturday: and this is Tuesday evening. Was it right to let loose those mice, undoubtedly the property of Simpkin? Alack, I am undone, for I have no more twist!"
final: jan pali li kama anpa lon poka seli, li toki e pilin ike ona: "kiwen len mute wan o lon, o kepeken linja loje a! ona o kama pini lon pini pi tenpo suno nanpa luka wan. a, tenpo ni li pini pi tenpo suno nanpa tu. mi ken e weka pi soweli lili ni la, ni li nasin ala nasin? pilin la, soweli Sinkin li lawa e ona. ike a, mi kama anpa, mi kama pini, tan ni: linja len loje li lon ala a."~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li kama anpa lon poka seli, li toki e pilin ike ona: "kiwen len mute wan o lon, o kepeken linja loje a! ona o kama pini lon pini pi tenpo suno nanpa luka wan. a, tenpo ni li pini pi tenpo suno nanpa tu. mi ken e weka pi soweli lili ni la, ni li nasin ala nasin? pilin la, soweli Sinkin li lawa e ona. ike a, mi kama anpa, mi kama pini, tan ni: linja len loje li lon ala a."

original: The little mice came out again and listened to the tailor; they took notice of the pattern of that wonderful coat. They whispered to one another about the taffeta lining and about little mouse tippets.
final: soweli pi lili mute li kama sin, li kute e toki pi jan pali. ona li lukin e pona pi pali jan, e pona len. ona li toki kulupu, li toki e len suno jelo pona, e linja namako, e len lili tawa pona pi soweli lili.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli pi lili mute li kama sin, li kute e toki pi jan pali. ona li lukin e pona pi pali jan, e pona len. ona li toki kulupu, li toki e len suno jelo pona, e linja namako, e len lili tawa pona pi soweli lili.

original: And then suddenly they all ran away together down the passage behind the wainscot, squeaking and calling to one another as they ran from house to house; and not one mouse was left in the tailor's kitchen when Simpkin came back with the pipkin of milk!
final: wawa la, ona li tawa weka kepeken wawa, li tawa anpa sinpin, li lon nasin pi insa sinpin. ona li mu lili, li wile tawa kulupu, li kama weka tan tomo. soweli Sinkin li jo e moku, li kama sin lon tomo jan la, soweli lili ala a li awen lon tomo.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: wawa la, ona li tawa weka kepeken wawa, li tawa anpa sinpin, li lon nasin pi insa sinpin. ona li mu lili, li wile tawa kulupu, li kama weka tan tomo. soweli Sinkin li jo e moku, li kama sin lon tomo jan la, soweli lili ala a li awen lon tomo.

original: Simpkin opened the door and bounced in, with an angry "G-r-r-miaw!" like a cat that is vexed; for he hated the snow, and there was snow in his ears, and snow in his collar at the back of his neck. He put down the loaf and the sausages upon the dresser, and sniffed.
final: soweli Sinkin li open e luka, li tawa insa, li mu e mu pi pilin ike. ona li pilin ike tan lete. ko walo lete li lon, li lon kute ona, li lon sewi ona, li lon insa pi len nimi ona. ona li pana e moku tawa supa, li pilin e kon kepeken nena.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli Sinkin li open e luka, li tawa insa, li mu e mu pi pilin ike. ona li pilin ike tan lete. ko walo lete li lon, li lon kute ona, li lon sewi ona, li lon insa pi len nimi ona. ona li pana e moku tawa supa, li pilin e kon kepeken nena.

original: Simpkin, said the tailor, "where is my twist?"
final: jan pali li toki tawa ona: "soweli Sinkin o, linja loje mi li lon seme?"~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li toki tawa ona: "soweli Sinkin o, linja loje mi li lon seme?"

original: But Simpkin set down the pipkin of milk upon the dresser, and looked suspiciously at the tea-cups. He wanted his supper of little fat mouse!
final: taso soweli Sinkin li pana e poki kiwen lon supa, li lukin e poki telo taso lon supa, li pilin e ken nasa. ona li wile moku e soweli pona pi lili mute!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: taso soweli Sinkin li pana e poki kiwen lon supa, li lukin e poki telo taso lon supa, li pilin e ken nasa. ona li wile moku e soweli pona pi lili mute!

original: Simpkin, said the tailor, "where is my twist?"
final: jan pali li toki tawa ona: "soweli Sinkin o, linja mi li lon seme?"~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li toki tawa ona: "soweli Sinkin o, linja mi li lon seme?"

original: But Simpkin hid a little parcel privately in the tea-pot, and spit and growled at the tailor; and if Simpkin had been able to talk, he would have asked: "Where is my Mouse?"
final: taso soweli Sinkin li len e ijo jan lon insa poki kiwen lon tenpo pini lili, li mu ike tawa jan pali. ona li ken ala toki, taso ona li ken la, ona li wile toki e ni: "soweli lili mi li lon seme?"~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: taso soweli Sinkin li len e ijo jan lon insa poki kiwen lon tenpo pini lili, li mu ike tawa jan pali. ona li ken ala toki, taso ona li ken la, ona li wile toki e ni: "soweli lili mi li lon seme?"

original: Alack, I am undone! said the Tailor of Gloucester, and went sadly to bed.
final: jan pali li kalama e ni: "a! mi kama anpa, mi kama weka, mi kama pakala!" pilin ike ona la, ona li tawa supa lape ona.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li kalama e ni: "a! mi kama anpa, mi kama weka, mi kama pakala!" pilin ike ona la, ona li tawa supa lape ona.

original: All that night long Simpkin hunted and searched through the kitchen, peeping into cupboards and under the wainscot, and into the tea-pot where he had hidden that twist; but still he found never a mouse!
final: tenpo pimeja ni la, soweli Sinkin li alasa, li alasa lon ale pi tomo moku, li lukin lon insa supa, li lukin lon insa sinpin, li lukin lon insa poki lon linja loje pi jan pali, li wile e soweli lili. taso ona li ken ala lukin e soweli lili.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: tenpo pimeja ni la, soweli Sinkin li alasa, li alasa lon ale pi tomo moku, li lukin lon insa supa, li lukin lon insa sinpin, li lukin lon insa poki lon linja loje pi jan pali, li wile e soweli lili. taso ona li ken ala lukin e soweli lili.

original: And whenever the tailor muttered and talked in his sleep, Simpkin said: "Miaw-ger-r-w-s-s-ch!" and made strange, horrid noises, as cats do at night.
final: jan pali li lape. ona li kalama lon lape la, soweli Sinkin li mu tawa ona, li kalama nasa, li kalama jaki. ni li nasin soweli lon tenpo pimeja.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li lape. ona li kalama lon lape la, soweli Sinkin li mu tawa ona, li kalama nasa, li kalama jaki. ni li nasin soweli lon tenpo pimeja.

original: For the poor old tailor was very ill with a fever, tossing and turning in his four-post bed; and still in his dreams he mumbled: "No more twist! no more twist!"
final: sijelo pi jan pali li kama ike, li kama seli. lape la, ona li tawa mute lon supa lape. ona li toki lape: "a, linja li lon ala! a, linja li lon ala!"~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: sijelo pi jan pali li kama ike, li kama seli. lape la, ona li tawa mute lon supa lape. ona li toki lape: "a, linja li lon ala! a, linja li lon ala!"

original: All that day he was ill, and the next day, and the next; and what should become of the cherry-coloured coat? In the tailor's shop in Westgate Street the embroidered silk and satin lay cut out upon the table—one-and-twenty buttonholes—and who should come to sew them, when the window was barred, and the door was fast locked?
final: ale pi tenpo suno ni en ale pi tenpo suno kama tu la, sijelo ona li ike. a, len loje pi awen seli li kama ala pini anu seme? tomo esun pi jan pali la, len suno en len pona li lon supa pali, li ken kama wan. kiwen len mute wan li lon kin! a, lupa li pini awen la, jan seme li ken tawa ona, li ken pali e ona?~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ale pi tenpo suno ni en ale pi tenpo suno kama tu la, sijelo ona li ike. a, len loje pi awen seli li kama ala pini anu seme? tomo esun pi jan pali la, len suno en len pona li lon supa pali, li ken kama wan. kiwen len mute wan li lon kin! a, lupa li pini awen la, jan seme li ken tawa ona, li ken pali e ona?

original: But that does not hinder the little brown mice; they run in and out without any keys through all the old houses in Gloucester!
final: taso soweli pi lili mute la, lupa pini li suli ala; ona li tawa insa kepeken ilo ala, li tawa insa tomo ale pi ma tomo Kota!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: taso soweli pi lili mute la, lupa pini li suli ala; ona li tawa insa kepeken ilo ala, li tawa insa tomo ale pi ma tomo Kota!

original: Out-of-doors the market folks went trudging through the snow to buy their geese and turkeys, and to bake their Christmas pies; but there would be no Christmas dinner for Simpkin and the poor old tailor of Gloucester.
final: ma esun la, jan esun li tawa lon ko lete walo, li wile esun e waso moku, li wile pali e pan pi tenpo suno sewi; taso soweli Sinkin en jan pi pali len la, tenpo suno sewi ni li ken ala.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ma esun la, jan esun li tawa lon ko lete walo, li wile esun e waso moku, li wile pali e pan pi tenpo suno sewi; taso soweli Sinkin en jan pi pali len la, tenpo suno sewi ni li ken ala.

original: The tailor lay ill for three days and nights; and then it was Christmas Eve, and very late at night. The moon climbed up over the roofs and chimneys, and looked down over the gateway into College Court. There were no lights in the windows, nor any sound in the houses; all the city of Gloucester was fast asleep under the snow.
final: jan pali li awen ike lon tenpo suno tu wan. ni la, tenpo sewi a li kama. tenpo pimeja li lon. mun li kama sewi lon sewi pi ma tomo, li lukin lon anpa, li lukin e lupa pi nasin Masona. suno ala li lon lupa lukin. kalama ala kin li lon tomo ale. ko lete walo en pimeja la, ale pi ma tomo li lape.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li awen ike lon tenpo suno tu wan. ni la, tenpo sewi a li kama. tenpo pimeja li lon. mun li kama sewi lon sewi pi ma tomo, li lukin lon anpa, li lukin e lupa pi nasin Masona. suno ala li lon lupa lukin. kalama ala kin li lon tomo ale. ko lete walo en pimeja la, ale pi ma tomo li lape.

original: And still Simpkin wanted his mice, and mewed as he stood beside the four-post bed.
final: tenpo ni kin la, soweli Sinkin li wile e soweli lili ona, li mu tawa supa lape.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: tenpo ni kin la, soweli Sinkin li wile e soweli lili ona, li mu tawa supa lape.

original: But it is in the old story that all the beasts can talk in the night between Christmas Eve and Christmas Day in the morning (though there are very few folk that can hear them, or know what it is that they say).
final: a, o sona: toki tenpo sewi la, soweli ale li ken toki lon tenpo pimeja sewi. (taso jan pi mute lili taso li ken kute e ona, li ken sona e toki ona.)~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: a, o sona: toki tenpo sewi la, soweli ale li ken toki lon tenpo pimeja sewi. (taso jan pi mute lili taso li ken kute e ona, li ken sona e toki ona.)

original: When the Cathedral clock struck twelve there was an answer—like an echo of the chimes—and Simpkin heard it, and came out of the tailor's door, and wandered about in the snow.
final: ilo tenpo pi tomo suli li kalama kepeken mu luka luka tu la, kalama ante li kama kin—sama mu ante pi ilo tenpo ante. soweli Sinkin li kute e ni, li weka tan tomo, li tawa lon ko walo lete.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ilo tenpo pi tomo suli li kalama kepeken mu luka luka tu la, kalama ante li kama kin—sama mu ante pi ilo tenpo ante. soweli Sinkin li kute e ni, li weka tan tomo, li tawa lon ko walo lete.

original: From all the roofs and gables and old wooden houses in Gloucester came a thousand merry voices singing the old Christmas rhymes—all the old songs that ever I heard of, and some that I don't know, like Whittington's bells.
final: tomo mute en tomo ale la, kalama pona mute mute a li kalama e musi e pilin tan tenpo pimeja sewi ni. ni li musi kalama ale pi sona pini mi, li musi pi sona ala mi kin.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: tomo mute en tomo ale la, kalama pona mute mute a li kalama e musi e pilin tan tenpo pimeja sewi ni. ni li musi kalama ale pi sona pini mi, li musi pi sona ala mi kin.

original: First and loudest the cocks cried out: "Dame, get up, and bake your pies!"
final: tenpo open la, waso kalama li kalama e musi, li kalama musi tan tenpo pimeja sewi ni.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: tenpo open la, waso kalama li kalama e musi, li kalama musi tan tenpo pimeja sewi ni.

original: Oh, dilly, dilly, dilly! sighed Simpkin.
final: soweli Sinkin li toki pilin: musi musi musi mu a.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli Sinkin li toki pilin: musi musi musi mu a.

original: And now in a garret there were lights and sounds of dancing, and cats came from over the way.
final: sewi pi tomo wan la, suno en kalama en tawa musi li lon. soweli mute li kama tan poka nasin ante.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: sewi pi tomo wan la, suno en kalama en tawa musi li lon. soweli mute li kama tan poka nasin ante.

original: Hey, diddle, diddle, the cat and the fiddle! All the cats in Gloucester—except me, said Simpkin,
final: soweli Sinkin li awen toki: musi mu tawa tan musi mu tawa taso. soweli ale li kama tan ale pi ma tomo. taso mi taso li kama ala.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli Sinkin li awen toki: musi mu tawa tan musi mu tawa taso. soweli ale li kama tan ale pi ma tomo. taso mi taso li kama ala.

original: Under the wooden eaves the starlings and sparrows sang of Christmas pies; the jackdaws woke up in the Cathedral tower; and although it was the middle of the night the throstles and robins sang; the air was quite full of little twittering tunes.
final: waso lili en waso suwi li mu e pan suwi pi tenpo sewi lon anpa pi sewi tomo. waso pimeja li pini e lape lon sewi palisa pi tomo sewi. waso pi sinpin walo en waso pi sinpin loje li open e mu lon tenpo lape ona. mu musi mute li lon kon ale a.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: waso lili en waso suwi li mu e pan suwi pi tenpo sewi lon anpa pi sewi tomo. waso pimeja li pini e lape lon sewi palisa pi tomo sewi. waso pi sinpin walo en waso pi sinpin loje li open e mu lon tenpo lape ona. mu musi mute li lon kon ale a.

original: But it was all rather provoking to poor hungry Simpkin.
final: taso ni ale li ike e pilin pi soweli Sinkin tan wile suli ona.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: taso ni ale li ike e pilin pi soweli Sinkin tan wile suli ona.

original: Particularly he was vexed with some little shrill voices from behind a wooden lattice. I think that they were bats, because they always have very small voices—especially in a black frost, when they talk in their sleep, like the Tailor of Gloucester.
final: ijo wan kin li ike nasa a tawa ona: kalama li kama tan sinpin pi kiwen kasi. sona mi la, ni li waso soweli. sona li kama tan kalama lili ona—lete wawa li lon la, ona li toki lon lape ona. jan pi pali len li toki lon lape kin.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ijo wan kin li ike nasa a tawa ona: kalama li kama tan sinpin pi kiwen kasi. sona mi la, ni li waso soweli. sona li kama tan kalama lili ona—lete wawa li lon la, ona li toki lon lape ona. jan pi pali len li toki lon lape kin.

original: They said something mysterious that sounded like—
final: toki ona li nasa li sama ni tawa kute—~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: toki ona li nasa li sama ni tawa kute—

original: Buzz, quoth the blue fly; hum, quoth the bee; Buzz and hum they cry, and so do we!
final: pipi waso lili laso li mu; pipi waso pimeja jelo li mu. mu li kalama tan ona tu. ni la, mi kalama sama ni tu.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: pipi waso lili laso li mu; pipi waso pimeja jelo li mu. mu li kalama tan ona tu. ni la, mi kalama sama ni tu.

original: and Simpkin went away shaking his ears as if he had a bee in his bonnet.
final: ni la, soweli Sinkin li tawa weka, li tawa e kute ona tan pipi pi lon ala.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ni la, soweli Sinkin li tawa weka, li tawa e kute ona tan pipi pi lon ala.

original: From the tailor's shop in Westgate came a glow of light; and when Simpkin crept up to peep in at the window it was full of candles. There was a snippeting of scissors, and snappeting of thread; and little mouse voices sang loudly and gaily:
final: suno li kama tan tomo pi pali len lon nasin Lupawese. soweli Sinkin li tawa ona, li lukin lon lupa lukin la, palisa seli suno mute li lon ni. kalama ilo en kalama kepeken en kalama linja en kalama pali li lon. kin la, kalama lili mute li mu e pilin pona tan soweli pi lili mute:~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: suno li kama tan tomo pi pali len lon nasin Lupawese. soweli Sinkin li tawa ona, li lukin lon lupa lukin la, palisa seli suno mute li lon ni. kalama ilo en kalama kepeken en kalama linja en kalama pali li lon. kin la, kalama lili mute li mu e pilin pona tan soweli pi lili mute:

original: ⁠ "Four-and-twenty tailors Went to catch a snail, The best man amongst them Durst not touch her tail; She put out her horns Like a little kyloe cow. Run, tailors, run! or she'll have you all e'en now!"⁠ Then without a pause the little mouse voices went on again:
final: "jan pali mute li wile, alasa e pipi - taso jan wawa ale, la monsi ona li jaki; pipi ko la palisa tu, li lon lawa ona; li ken utala, e jan pali, la jan o tawa!" kepeken tenpo ala la, kalama pi soweli lili li kalama sin:~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: "jan pali mute li wile, alasa e pipi - taso jan wawa ale, la monsi ona li jaki; pipi ko la palisa tu, li lon lawa ona; li ken utala, e jan pali, la jan o tawa!" kepeken tenpo ala la, kalama pi soweli lili li kalama sin:

original: Sieve my lady's oatmeal, Grind my lady's flour, Put it in a chestnut, Let it stand an hour——
final: "o pona tawa e pan ko, o pona kiwen e ko pan, o ona e kili kiwen, o  awen lon tenpo pona——"~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: "o pona tawa e pan ko, o pona kiwen e ko pan, o ona e kili kiwen, o  awen lon tenpo pona——"

original: Mew! Mew! interrupted Simpkin, and he scratched at the door. But the key was under the tailor's pillow; he could not get in.
final: soweli Sinkin li pini e ni kepeken mu mu a, li noka wawa e lupa. taso ilo awen li awen pini e lupa. ilo open li lon anpa len lon anpa pi jan ona. soweli li ken ala insa tan ni.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli Sinkin li pini e ni kepeken mu mu a, li noka wawa e lupa. taso ilo awen li awen pini e lupa. ilo open li lon anpa len lon anpa pi jan ona. soweli li ken ala insa tan ni.

original: The little mice only laughed, and tried another tune—
final: ni la, soweli lili li kalama e pilin pona, li kalama musi sin—~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ni la, soweli lili li kalama e pilin pona, li kalama musi sin—

original: Three little mice sat down to spin, Pussy passed by and she peeped in. What are you at, my fine little men? Making coats for gentlemen. Shall I come in and cut off your threads? Oh, no, Miss Pussy, you'd bite off our heads!
final: soweli lili li pali e linja, soweli alasa li sama ala; li wile sona, e pali pona. pali li seme? li lon tan seme? pali li len, li lon tan jan. soweli alasa li ken ala ken kama, li ken ala ken tu, e linja len? ala a, soweli alasa o, sina tu e, lawa mi taso!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli lili li pali e linja, soweli alasa li sama ala; li wile sona, e pali pona. pali li seme? li lon tan seme? pali li len, li lon tan jan. soweli alasa li ken ala ken kama, li ken ala ken tu, e linja len? ala a, soweli alasa o, sina tu e, lawa mi taso!

original: Mew! Mew! cried Simpkin.
final: soweli Sinkin li kalama: mu! mu!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli Sinkin li kalama: mu! mu!

original: Hey diddle dinketty! answered the little mice—
final: soweli lili li toki kin: soweli o o o, a a a~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli lili li toki kin: soweli o o o, a a a

original: Hey diddle dinketty, poppetty pet! The merchants of London they wear scarlet; Silk in the collar, and gold in the hem, So merrily march the merchantmen!
final: soweli o o, a a, len pi jan esun li loje lon ma, len selo sewi li suno kule, len seli anpa li jelo kule, jan esun li tawa lon musi ni!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli o o, a a, len pi jan esun li loje lon ma, len selo sewi li suno kule, len seli anpa li jelo kule, jan esun li tawa lon musi ni!

original: They clicked their thimbles to mark the time, but none of the songs pleased Simpkin; he sniffed and mewed at the door of the shop.
final: ona li pali e kalama kepeken poki luka lili ona, taso kalama ala li pona tawa soweli Sinkin. ona li nena e lupa, li mu tawa lupa, li wile insa esun.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ona li pali e kalama kepeken poki luka lili ona, taso kalama ala li pona tawa soweli Sinkin. ona li nena e lupa, li mu tawa lupa, li wile insa esun.

original: And then I bought A pipkin and a popkin, A slipkin and a slopkin, All for one farthing——and upon the kitchen dresser! added the rude little mice.
final: soweli lili wan pi wile nasa li pana e kalama kin: "mi esun e poki pi telo wawa, mi esun e pan wan pona kin, mi kepeken mani wan taso——mi pana e ale ni lon supa poki!"~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli lili wan pi wile nasa li pana e kalama kin: "mi esun e poki pi telo wawa, mi esun e pan wan pona kin, mi kepeken mani wan taso——mi pana e ale ni lon supa poki!"

original: Mew! scratch! scratch! scuffled Simpkin on the window-sill; while the little mice inside sprang to their feet, and all began to shout at once in little twittering voices: "No more twist! No more twist!" And they barred up the window-shutters and shut out Simpkin.
final: soweli Sinkin li mu wawa, li luka wawa, li luka e lupa. tenpo sama la, soweli lili ale li kama tawa, li kama kalama: "linja len li kama pini! linja li lon ala!" ona ale li len ilo e lupa lukin, li pini e lukin lupa pi soweli Sinkin.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli Sinkin li mu wawa, li luka wawa, li luka e lupa. tenpo sama la, soweli lili ale li kama tawa, li kama kalama: "linja len li kama pini! linja li lon ala!" ona ale li len ilo e lupa lukin, li pini e lukin lupa pi soweli Sinkin.

original: But still through the nicks in the shutters he could hear the click of thimbles, and little mouse voices singing:
final: taso lupa lili li lon len ilo pi lupa lukin la, ona li ken kute e poki luka lili, e kalama musi soweli:~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: taso lupa lili li lon len ilo pi lupa lukin la, ona li ken kute e poki luka lili, e kalama musi soweli:

original: No more twist! No more twist!
final: linja li lon ala! linja li lon ala!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: linja li lon ala! linja li lon ala!

original: Simpkin came away from the shop and went home considering in his mind. He found the poor old tailor without fever, sleeping peacefully.
final: soweli Sinkin li tawa tan esun, li tawa tomo ona. kon ona li pali mute lon lawa ona. ona li tawa jan ona, li lukin e jan. jan pali la, seli ike li weka. jan li lape pona.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli Sinkin li tawa tan esun, li tawa tomo ona. kon ona li pali mute lon lawa ona. ona li tawa jan ona, li lukin e jan. jan pali la, seli ike li weka. jan li lape pona.

original: Then Simpkin went on tip-toe and took a little parcel of silk out of the tea-pot; and looked at it in the moonlight; and he felt quite ashamed of his badness compared with those good little mice!
final: soweli Sinkin li tawa kepeken kalama ala, li tawa supa poki, li tawa poki kiwen, li jo e linja len tan poki. ona li lukin e linja lon suno mun. soweli pi lili mute li pona, li pali pona. taso soweli Sinkin li pali ike sama ala soweli lili la, ona li pilin ike tan pali ni.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: soweli Sinkin li tawa kepeken kalama ala, li tawa supa poki, li tawa poki kiwen, li jo e linja len tan poki. ona li lukin e linja lon suno mun. soweli pi lili mute li pona, li pali pona. taso soweli Sinkin li pali ike sama ala soweli lili la, ona li pilin ike tan pali ni.

original: When the tailor awoke in the morning, the first thing which he saw, upon the patchwork quilt, was a skein of cherry-coloured twisted silk, and beside his bed stood the repentant Simpkin!
final: jan pali li pilin e lape la, ona li kama lukin e linja len loje pona a lon supa lape ona, e soweli Sinkin kin pi pilin ike lon poka supa!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan pali li pilin e lape la, ona li kama lukin e linja len loje pona a lon supa lape ona, e soweli Sinkin kin pi pilin ike lon poka supa!

original: Alack, I am worn to a ravelling, said the tailor of Gloucester, "but I have my twist!"
final: jan li toki: "pakala, mi pilin wawa ala. taso mi jo e linja len a"~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan li toki: "pakala, mi pilin wawa ala. taso mi jo e linja len a"

original: The sun was shining on the snow when the tailor got up and dressed, and came out into the street with Simpkin running before him.
final: suno li suno e lete walo la, jan li tawa, li len e sijelo ona, li tan tomo, li tawa lon nasin. soweli Sinkin li lon poka ona.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: suno li suno e lete walo la, jan li tawa, li len e sijelo ona, li tan tomo, li tawa lon nasin. soweli Sinkin li lon poka ona.

original: The starlings whistled on the chimney stacks, and the throstles and robins sang—but they sang their own little noises, not the words they had sung in the night.
final: waso lili li mu lon sewi tomo. waso pi sinpin walo en waso pi sinpin loje li mu kin—taso mu ni li mu kalama taso, li mu toki ala sama tenpo pimeja sewi.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: waso lili li mu lon sewi tomo. waso pi sinpin walo en waso pi sinpin loje li mu kin—taso mu ni li mu kalama taso, li mu toki ala sama tenpo pimeja sewi.

original: Alack, said the tailor, "I have my twist; but no more strength—nor time—than will serve to make me one single buttonhole; for this is Christmas Day in the Morning! The Mayor of Gloucester shall be married by noon —and where is his cherry-coloured coat?"
final: jan li toki: "pakala. mi jo e linja pona, taso mi jo ala e wawa. tenpo li lon ala kin. mi ken ala pali mute tan ni: tenpo suno ni li tenpo suno sewi la, jan lawa pi ma tomo Kota en olin ona li wile kama wan lon olin—taso len loje ona li lon seme? ona li lon ala a! tenpo mi la, mi ken pali e selo lupa wan taso a."~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jan li toki: "pakala. mi jo e linja pona, taso mi jo ala e wawa. tenpo li lon ala kin. mi ken ala pali mute tan ni: tenpo suno ni li tenpo suno sewi la, jan lawa pi ma tomo Kota en olin ona li wile kama wan lon olin—taso len loje ona li lon seme? ona li lon ala a! tenpo mi la, mi ken pali e selo lupa wan taso a."

original: He unlocked the door of the little shop in Westgate Street, and Simpkin ran in, like a cat that expects something.
final: ona li open e esun ona lon nasin Lupawese. wawa la, soweli Sinkin li tawa insa sama alasa sona.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: ona li open e esun ona lon nasin Lupawese. wawa la, soweli Sinkin li tawa insa sama alasa sona.

original: But there was no one there! Not even one little brown mouse!
final: taso suli ala li lon. soweli lili kin li lon ala a!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: taso suli ala li lon. soweli lili kin li lon ala a!

original: The boards were swept and clean; the little ends of thread and the little silk snippets were all tidied away, and gone from off the floor.
final: jaki ala en pona taso li lon supa ale. linja lili en len lili en jaki len en ko lili li weka, li lon ala ma anpa.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: jaki ala en pona taso li lon supa ale. linja lili en len lili en jaki len en ko lili li weka, li lon ala ma anpa.

original: But upon the table—oh joy! the tailor gave a shout—there, where he had left plain cuttings of silk there lay the most beautifullest coat and embroidered satin waistcoat that ever were worn by a Mayor of Gloucester!
final: taso supa pali la jan pali li mu pi pilin pona a! supa ni la, jan pali li pini ala e len lon tenpo pini, li lukin e len pini pona a lon tenpo ni. len li suwi mute lon lukin, li pona suli tawa jan lawa ale pi ma Kote a!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: taso supa pali la jan pali li mu pi pilin pona a! supa ni la, jan pali li pini ala e len lon tenpo pini, li lukin e len pini pona a lon tenpo ni. len li suwi mute lon lukin, li pona suli tawa jan lawa ale pi ma Kote a!

original: There were roses and pansies upon the facings of the coat; and the waistcoat was worked with poppies and corn-flowers.
final: kasi loje en kasi suwi li lon supa pi len seli a. kasi pan pona en kasi linja suwi li lon len pi sijelo sewi a.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: kasi loje en kasi suwi li lon supa pi len seli a. kasi pan pona en kasi linja suwi li lon len pi sijelo sewi a.

original: Everything was finished except just one single cherry-coloured buttonhole, and where that buttonhole was wanting there was pinned a scrap of paper with these words—in little teeny weeny writing—
final: pali len li kama pini, taso pali wan taso li pini ala: selo lupa loje wan li pini ala, li wile e pali lili, li jo e lipu lili. lipu ni la, jan li lukin e nimi pi lili mute:~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: pali len li kama pini, taso pali wan taso li pini ala: selo lupa loje wan li pini ala, li wile e pali lili, li jo e lipu lili. lipu ni la, jan li lukin e nimi pi lili mute:

original: NO MORE TWIST.
final: LINJA LI LON ALA.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: LINJA LI LON ALA.

original: And from then began the luck of the Tailor of Gloucester; he grew quite stout, and he grew quite rich.
final: tenpo pi ni ale la, pona li kama lon jan pi pali len. ona li kama wawa, li kama jo e mani mute.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: tenpo pi ni ale la, pona li kama lon jan pi pali len. ona li kama wawa, li kama jo e mani mute.

original: He made the most wonderful waistcoats for all the rich merchants of Gloucester, and for all the fine gentlemen of the country round.
final: len ona li pona wawa tawa jan esun ale pi mani mute, li pona kin tawa jan mani pi ma poka ale.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: len ona li pona wawa tawa jan esun ale pi mani mute, li pona kin tawa jan mani pi ma poka ale.

original: Never were seen such ruffles, or such embroidered cuffs and lappets! But his buttonholes were the greatest triumph of it all.
final: len ona la, namako pi sike mute en namako pi luka pini en namako pi linja sike mute li suwi pona a! taso selo lupa ona li suli sewi a.~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: len ona la, namako pi sike mute en namako pi luka pini en namako pi linja sike mute li suwi pona a! taso selo lupa ona li suli sewi a.

original: The stitches of those buttonholes were so neat—so neat—I wonder how they could be stitched by an old man in spectacles, with crooked old fingers, and a tailor's thimble.
final: selo lupa ale ona li kepeken linja pi lili suwi a—linja li lili suwi la, ni li ken ala ken tan jan pali pi tenpo mute, tan luka jan pi wawa ala?~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: selo lupa ale ona li kepeken linja pi lili suwi a—linja li lili suwi la, ni li ken ala ken tan jan pali pi tenpo mute, tan luka jan pi wawa ala?

original: The stitches of those buttonholes were so small—so small—they looked as if they had been made by little mice!
final: linja li lili suwi mute la, lili ni li ken tan soweli pi lili mute a!~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: linja li lili suwi mute la, lili ni li ken tan soweli pi lili mute a!

original: THE END
final: PINI~~~~jan Ke Tami
jan Ke Tami: PINI
